releases.details: Available exclusively from branches of Woolworths.
Special features include commentary and interviews.
special_features: Commentary by Colin Baker, Nicola Bryant, and Kevin McNally
The Star Man - An interview with title sequence designer Sid Sutton
Look 100 Years Younger - Discussion on the Doctor's costumes
Stripped for Action: The Sixth Doctor - Comic strip adventures
Breakfast Time - Interview with Colin Baker and Nicola Bryant
Photo Gallery - Includes unreleased incidental music
Coming Soon Trailer - The Keys of Marinus

notes: The story contrasts sharply with the previous serial's positive reception.
Considered the worst Doctor Who story in several polls.
Introduces a new title sequence featuring the Sixth Doctor.

in_universe_mythology: Jacondan myth involving a Sun God and Gastropods.
real_world_cultural_references: Beau Brummell and the poem 'Excelsior' by Longfellow.
individuals: Romulus and Remus Sylvest - kidnapped twins
Professor Edgeworth / Azmael - the Doctor's friend

continuity_notes: Follows the regeneration from the previous Doctor, where he faced Spectrox toxaemia.

plot.plot_summary: After regenerating, the Doctor behaves erratically and takes his companion Peri to a desolate asteroid. They uncover a plot involving alien Gastropods kidnapping twins, led by Mestor, as they grapple with the Doctor's unstable behavior and the threat to the galaxy.
